content: The novel "To Kill a Mockingbird" was written by which author, whose other work, "Go Set a Watchman", was published posthumously?

"To Kill a Mockingbird" was written by Harper Lee. Her other work, "Go Set a Watchman," was indeed published posthumously in 2015. It's interesting to note that "Go Set a Watchman" was actually written before "To Kill a Mockingbird," but it was originally intended as a first draft. However, Lee's editor suggested that she expand the flashback sequences in the story, which led to the creation of "To Kill a Mockingbird." The original manuscript of "Go Set a Watchman" was later rediscovered and published after Lee's death.
